questions.Q: In a gear with two toothed wheels, one wheel has $$24$$ teeth and the other has $$48$$ teeth. If the bigger wheel turns two times in one second, the number of turns per second that the smaller wheel spins is:
questions.E: In both wheels the $$d$$ separation distance between consecutive teeth must be equal. Thus, $$nd=2\pi r$$ and $$Nd=2\pi R$$ $$\therefore\, \frac{N}{n}=\frac{R}{r}$$, where $$N=48$$ and $$n=24$$. On the other hand, the tangential velocities of the wheels are equal, i.e., $$\omega_1 r=\omega_2 R\,\therefore \, \omega_1=\omega_2\frac{R}{r}$$ Taking into account the relationship between the radii and the number of teeth of the wheels we have $$\omega_1=\omega_2\frac{N}{n}\\$$ Notice that $$\omega=2\pi f$$ where $$f$$ is the frequency. Therefore, $$f_1=f_2\frac{N}{n}$$. Taking $$f_2=2\,\text{Hz}$$ and the values for $$N$$ and $$n$$ we have $$f_1=4\,\text{Hz}$$

questions.Q: In a gear with two toothed wheels, one wheel has $$24$$ teeth and the other has $$48$$ teeth. If the smaller wheel turns four times in one second,, the number of turns per second that the bigger wheel spins is:
questions.E: In both wheels the $$d$$ separation distance between consecutive teeth must be equal. Thus, $$nd=2\pi r$$ and $$Nd=2\pi R$$ $$\therefore\, \frac{N}{n}=\frac{R}{r}$$, where $$N=48$$ and $$n=24$$. On the other hand, the tangential velocities of the wheels are equal, i.e., $$\omega_1 r=\omega_2 R\,\therefore \, \omega_2=\omega_1\frac{r}{R}$$ Taking into account the relationship between the radii and the number of teeth of the wheels we have $$\omega_2=\omega_1\frac{n}{N}\\$$ Notice that $$\omega=2\pi f$$ where $$f$$ is the frequency. Therefore, $$f_2=f_1\frac{n}{N}$$. Taking $$f_1=4\,\text{Hz}$$ and the values for $$N$$ and $$n$$ we have $$f_2=2\,\text{Hz}$$

questions.Q: A juggler throws a bowling pin into the air with an initial velocity as shown in figure. As the center of mass of the pin describes a parabola, the pin spins around its center of mass. The angular velocity of the pin is:
questions.E: The angular displacement of the pin changes $$33^o$$ anticlockwise every 0.2 s. Besides,  $$33^o=33^{o}\times \frac{\pi}{180^{o}}=0.576\,\text{rad}$$ The angular velocity of the pin is $$\omega=\frac{\Delta\theta}{\Delta t}=\frac{0.576\,\text{rad}}{0.2\,\text{s}}=2.88\,\frac{\text{rad}}{\text{s}}$$ anticlockwise.

questions.Q: A thoothed wheel is meshed to a gear rack as shown in figure. If the angular velocity of the wheel is $$\omega$$, the upward velocity $$v$$ of the gear rack is:

A.opt: $$\frac{\omega r}{2N}$$ where $$N$$ is the number of teeth of the wheel

questions.E: The tangential velocity of the wheel is equal to the linear velocity of the gear rack, i.e., $$v=\omega r$$
